title: LD50 Dose of Pesticides in Roaches

content.question: A pesticide was applied to a population of roaches, and it was determined that the <math alttext="L D 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD</mtext><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was <math alttext="55 milligrams per kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the average mass of a roach was <math alttext="0.02 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following approaches will determine the dose in <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per roach?

choices.label: <math alttext="The fraction 55 milligrams per 1 kilogram times the fraction 1 over 0.02 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The fraction 55 milligrams per 1 kilogram times 50 percent times 0.02 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>%</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The fraction 55 milligrams times 1 kilogram times 0.02 kilogram " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, the fraction 0.02 kilogram over 1 times the fraction 55 milligrams per 1 kilogram, and denominator 50 percent " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>%</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="The fraction 55 milligrams times 1 kilogram times 0.02 kilogram " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
